Description: An ivory oil label: with a hole for attachment at the top right-hand corner. The front surface bears an incised inscription, coloured in black and red. The label is slightly chipped on the inscribed face.
Curator's comments: Bibliography (selective): W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pls. XII, 1; XVII, 26; F. Legge, ‘Proceedings of the Society of Biblical Archaeology’ 29 (London, 1907), pl. I, 10 F. Legge, ‘Proceedings of the Society of Biblical Archaeology’ 30 (London, 1908), pl. Va; P. E. Newberry, ‘Proceedings of the Society of Biblical Archaeology’ 34 (London, 1912), pl. XXXII, 12; A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], 'Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo' (Ravenna, 1998), p.229 [189]; F. Tiradritti, 'Sesh : lingue e scritture nell'antico Egitto : inediti dal Museo archeologico di Milano' (Milan, 1999), p.23 [4]. See also P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl. 144, abb. 847B (Smr-ḫt a I). Discussions: Sethe, 'Untersuchungen' III, 68; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, 23, 43-3; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 983, n. 1552. A duplicate of this label has been found at Tûra, see loc. cit. and J. Leclant, 'Orientalia' 30 (1961), 104. For another similar fragment, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. VIII, 5; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), pl. XI, 9.
